								%comment%
							Element:br

								%comment%!!!!'''Mob (Event ID#51)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								%comment%This event records information regarding item purchases, sales, or trades outside of the developer RMT game store. This event requires both an incoming and outgoing value, of which either can be 0. To log an economic event, you need to pass the sender and receiver account and character IDs; the item name and ID; the economic type and value; the currency type and value; along with the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the shard ID, virtual currency type and count.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								%comment%'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								%comment%|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								%comment%||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Date || TIMESTAMP || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || SENDER ACCOUNT ID || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || SENDER CHARACTER ID || SENDER ACCOUNT ID ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || RECEIVER CHARACTER ID || RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Long || SHARD ID || 0 ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Long || ITEM ID || If ITEM ID is empty, and ITEM NAME is not empty, use 0. ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || ITEM NAME || If ITEM ID is not empty, and ITEM NAME is empty, use NA. ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || ECONOMIC TYPE || Other [[Appendix#economic-type |(See Appendix A for more types)]]||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Float || ECONOMIC VALUE || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Integer || CURRENCY TYPE || ''No Default Value'' * ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| String || VIRTUAL CURRENCY TYPE || If CURRENCY TYPE is 1 then mandatory. Otherwise defaults to Null. ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Float || CURRENCY VALUE || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								%comment%|| Integer || VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT || Null ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								%comment%[- *Currency Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Real' and 1 equals 'Virtual Currency'.-]

								A Mob refers to a group of non-player characters (NPCs). This event records information on when a player confronts and kills a Mob. To log a mob event, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, and the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the shard ID and description of the kill.

							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || ACCOUNT ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || KILL MOB DESCRIPTION || Null ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a mob is defeated\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi''.logMob(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, KILL_MOB_DESCRIPTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JSON
							Element:br
								//Log when a mob is defeated\\
							Element:br
							Element:br
								{
							Element:br

								Logs a Currency Transaction event. Covers all types of transaction in the game or any other environment where real world money was used. Designed To Handle Most Currency Transactions. More Complicated Transactions Can Be Done Within Event #37.
						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:br
								Changed line 2586 from: Please note that you should only use this event when the Item Transaction (#17) or Store Buy Item (#37) events aren't appropriate. Store Buy Item (#37) should be used in most cases of any type of currency or virtual currency transactions. If currency is being spent to acquire something, it is preferable to use those events so that the purchase can be associated with the item. Do not send the Currency Transaction event in tandem with those events, because the currency transfer will be double counted on your dashboard. to:
						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:ins
								%comment%
								Please note that you should only use this event when the Item Transaction (#17) or Store Buy Item (#37) events aren't appropriate. Store Buy Item (#37) should be used in most cases of any type of currency or virtual currency transactions. If currency is being spent to acquire something, it is preferable to use those events so that the purchase can be associated with the item. Do not send the Currency Transaction event in tandem with those events, because the currency transfer will be double counted on your dashboard.

							Element:br
							Element:br
								Account Management events include those events that are related to the creation, deletion, and management of a user or character account. Details on how to execute calls to log account events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Create Account (Event ID#9)'''[[#CreateAccount]]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the creation of a new account, including the user's demographics. To log the creation of an account you need to pass the account ID and type; the user's language, country, gender, and date of birth; as well as the platform and the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass their currency balance and old account ID.

								'''Note''': You must log the account creation information before any log or load command references the account ID.

								!!!!'''Player Points (Event ID#24)'''[[#PlayerPoints]]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding when a player gains points in the game. Points are used as an indicator of how well the player is doing in the game and how far they have progressed. Typically, gaining enough points leads the player to level-up to a higher level. To log player points, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the character level, the point amount and type, along with the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the shard ID and whether or not the points are grouped.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||XP TIMESTAMP ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0.||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||POINT_TYPE ||Default = XP, {XP, GENERIC_POINTS, OTHER}||
							Element:br
								||Long ||XP AMOUNT ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Boolean ||GROUPED FLAG || N||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Point Type default is XP, alternate options include 'Generic Point', and 'Other'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br

							Element:br

								common scenario is when a user purchases virtual currency by spending real currency. In this case, you should send this event twice. Once with a TRANSACTION TYPE of 0 and a CURRENCY TYPE of 0 (the user is spending real currency), and then again with a TRANSACTION TYPE of 1 and a CURRENCY TYPE of 1, along with the appropriate VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT and LABEL (the user is acquiring virtual currency). to: One common scenario is when a user purchases virtual currency by spending real currency. In this case, you should send this event twice. Once with a TRANSACTION TYPE of 0 and a CURRENCY TYPE of 0 (the user is spending real currency), and then again with a TRANSACTION TYPE of 1 and a CURRENCY TYPE of 1, along with the appropriate VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT and LABEL (the user is acquiring virtual currency).

						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:span
								Russ Harvey
								- Add further explanation for Friend Addition/Deletion Added lines 3118-3119:
						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:ins
								Please note that this is a one-way, "follow" type of addition. If Bob is accepting a friend request from Alice, and they will subsequently appear on each other's friends list, then two events should be sent. One with Alice as the sender and Bob as the recipient, and another with Bob as the sender and Alice as the recipient. If Alice is simply following Bob without any action on his part, then you only need to send a single event with Alice as the sender and Bob as the recipient.
						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:br
								Added lines 3171-3172:
						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:ins
							Element:br
								Please note that this is a one-way, "unfollow" type of deletion. If Alice and Bob are currently in each other's friends list, and a removal from one party will cause them to be dropped from both lists, then you should send two deletion events. One with Alice as the sender and Bob as the recipient, and another with Bob as the sender and Alice as the recipient.
						Node:
						(type) c

								!!!!'''Account Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Account Type describes the account payment type. Note that some accounts could have more than one Account Type value
							Element:br
								*Standard Transaction (All standard transactions from the site or store.)
							Element:br
								*Recurring Subscription
							Element:br
								*Store Card: Time
							Element:br
								*Store Card: In-App/Site Currency
							Element:br
								*Non-Paying
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br

								!!!!'''Country Code'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Amongst the online resources you'll find a standardized list of [[http://developer.ninjametrics.com/docs/ | recommended country codes]]. If a non-standard country code is used Katana will convert it to one of the standardized codes, based on the nearest probable code.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''CRM Action Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Free Item, Specific (A particular item giveaway.)
							Element:br
								*Free Item, Range (A range of items in a giveaway, therefore the user can pick from a range of items.)
							Element:br
								*Free Time
							Element:br
								*Discounted Item, Specific (A particular item offered at discount.)
							Element:br
								*Discounted Item, Range (A range of items offered at a discount, therefore the user can pick from a range of items.)
							Element:br
								*Discounted Time
							Element:br
								*Social Promotion – Shared (A shared promotion with a friend.)
							Element:br
								*Social Promotion - Pay Forward (A promotion passed on to a friend.)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br
								Custom Action Types is designed to hold types not found on any other list.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Note that each list already allows the addition of custom subtypes. This list should be used for whole categories that the system has not anticipated.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Economic Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Economic Types are related to in-game items not necessarily connected to a real-world value. This field also allows for a value for the item, whether in real-world or in-app currency.
							Element:br
								*Buy Item
							Element:br
								*Sell Item
							Element:br
								*Trade Away Item
							Element:br
								*Trade Acquire Item
							Element:br
								*Create Item
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Farmer Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								The following Farmer Type categories were developed by following the narco-trafficking system, and have been found to be reliable across game titles. Although some characters play multiple roles you should tag them with their primary function.
							Element:br
								*Banker (A Character used primarily to store virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Gatherer (A Character used primarily to gather virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Mule (A Character used primarily to transfer virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Spammer (A Character used primarily to advertise virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br

								!!!!'''Item Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								If your system has UGC, items can have both an item type and a user-generated content type.
							Element:br
								*Raw Materials (Raw building block items used for crafting, creating enchantments, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Mounts And Pets
							Element:br
								*Weapons
							Element:br
								*Tools (e.g. an axe in Minecraft)
							Element:br
								*Armor
							Element:br
								*Upgrades, Buffs and Enchantments (Items that improve another item, e.g. cannons on a truck, more damage to a sword, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Display Items (Items that have little play value but look nice, e.g. candlesticks)
							Element:br
								*Aesthetic Items (Character skins or clothing that change appearance, but don't change character ability.)
							Element:br
								*Housing
							Element:br
								*Vehicle
							Element:br
								*Vendor Trash (Items that have no playable purpose.)
							Element:br
								*Containers
							Element:br
								*Tools
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br

								OGIs are out-of-game interactions; something users do out in the world that you, the developer, still tracks. This is likely to be social media or forum activity, but could be anything of use.
							Element:br

								184.66.153.4
								- Added lines 1-2742:
						Node:
						(type) c
						(layer)2
							Element:ins
								Get the complete experience. Follow this ''Advanced Setup Guide ''to get the most out of Katana Analytics. This guide includes the information you need to log all available events, including events custom to your title. You'll find the events are organized based on 10 primary event categories:
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_System_Events | System Events]]
							Element:br
								System events include those events that are system related, such as when a player logs in or out of the application, or when a shard is initialized.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_Account_Management_Events | Account Management Events]]
							Element:br
								Account Management events include those events that are related to the creation, deletion, and management of a user or character account.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark45 | Game Events]]
							Element:br
								Game events include those events that are related to in-game characters, actions, and combat.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark60 | Item Events]]
							Element:br
								Item events include those events that are related to the creation, use, and transaction of in- game items.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark67 | Group Events]]
							Element:br
								Group events include those events involving player interaction with a group or guild such as entry, exit, or a player's position within a guild (e.g. Guild Leader).
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark74 | Environment Events]]
							Element:br
								Environment events include those events that are related to in-game levels and areas that players may encounter.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark80 | Economic Events]]
							Element:br
								Economic events include those events that are related to in-game stores and purchases such as a player's interaction with a store and items within it.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark89 | Transaction Events]]
							Element:br
								Transaction events include those events that are related to economic events outside of the game such as when an item is purchased outside of the developer game store, or when a subscription changes.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark94 | Social Events]]
							Element:br
								Social events include social interactions between players in and outside of the game such as messages, off-game-interactions, friend requests, etc.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[[#_bookmark105 | Custom Events]]
							Element:br
								Custom events include those events that relate to custom actions, and CRM actions. As a Ninja Metrics customer you have the freedom to define custom events in any way that you want given the fields described under the ''Custom Slot Action ''and ''Custom Action ''sections.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''System Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								System events include those events that are system related, such as when a player logs in or out of the application, or when a shard is initialized. Details on how to execute calls to log system events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!''' Login (Event ID#1)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records the time at which the user logged into the system (website, game, software, etc.). To log a login event, you need to pass the user's account ID, character ID, platform, location at login, shard ID, and timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the login area name.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Items, Location/Maps, NPC, Social)
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn, Farming, Integrity)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||LOGIN TIMESTAMP ||Yes || (Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||PLATFORM ||Yes ||Other||
							Element:br
								||Long ||LOGIN AREA ID ||Yes ||Null||
							Element:br
								||String ||LOGIN AREA NAME ||No ||Null||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user logs in\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logLogin(LOGIN_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, PLATFORM, LOGIN_AREA_ID, LOGIN_AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user logs in\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logLogin(LOGIN_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, PLATFORM, LOGIN_AREA_ID, LOGIN_AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user logs in\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logLogin(LOGIN_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, PLATFORM, LOGIN_AREA_ID, LOGIN_AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Logout (Event ID#2)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records the time at which the user logged out of the system (website, game, software, etc.). To log a logout event, you need to pass the user's account ID, character ID, and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn, Farming, Integrity)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||LOGOUT TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user logs out\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logLogout(LOGOUT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user logs out[[<<]]
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logLogout(LOGOUT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user logs out\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi''->logLogout(LOGOUT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Initialize Shard (Event ID#13)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Many games and environments have multiple instances running in parallel. In our schema, these parallel instances are referred to as shards. Shards are the same as running multiple instances of the game, or other environments, on different servers. To initialize a shard, you need to pass the shard ID and description, as well as a timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note''': You must log the shard creation information before any log or load command references the shard ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||SHARD DESCRIPTION ||Yes ||NA||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log shard creation information\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadInitShard(SHARD_ID, SHARD_DESCRIPTION, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log shard creation information\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''loadInitShard(SHARD_ID, SHARD_DESCRIPTION, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log shard creation information\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadInitShard(SHARD_ID, SHARD_DESCRIPTION, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Ad Click (Event ID#57)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information when a user clicks on an Ad, or clicks on an Ad and takes some subsequent action. To log that a user has clicked an Ad you need to pass the user's account ID and the time the Ad was clicked. Optionally, you can pass the Ad tag name and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| Date || AD CLICK TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time)||
							Element:br
								|| String || AD TAG NAME || No || In App (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| Date || AD ACTION TIMESTAMP || No || Null ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a user clicks an Ad\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logAd(ACCOUNT_ID, AD_CLICK_TIMESTAMP, AD_TAG_NAME, AD_ACTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user clicks an Ad\\ aKApi.''logAd(ACCOUNT_ID, AD_CLICK_TIMESTAMP, AD_TAG_NAME, AD_ACTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user clicks an Ad\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logAd(ACCOUNT_ID, AD_CLICK_TIMESTAMP, AD_TAG_NAME, AD_ACTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Account Management Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Account Management events include those events that are related to the creation, deletion, and management of a user or character account. Details on how to execute calls to log account events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Create Account (Event ID#9)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the creation of a new account, including the user's demographics. To log the creation of an account you need to pass the account ID and type; the user's language, country, gender, date of birth, and currency balance; as well as the platform and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note''': You must log the account creation information before any log or load command references the account ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn, Farming, Integrity)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||CREATION TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT TYPE ||Yes ||Free||
							Element:br
								||String ||LANGUAGE ||Yes ||N0||
							Element:br
								||String ||COUNTRY ||Yes ||N0||
							Element:br
								||String ||GENDER ||Yes ||N||
							Element:br
								||Date ||DOB ||Yes ||"1900-01-01 000:000:00.0000000"||
							Element:br
								||Float ||CURRENCY BALANCE ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||PLATFORM ||Yes ||Other||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user creates an account\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadAccountCreated(CREATION_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, ACCOUNT_TYPE, LANGUAGE, COUNTRY, GENDER, DOB, CURRENCY_BALANCE, PLATFORM);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScrip
							Element:br
								//Log when a user creates an account\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''loadAccountCreate(CREATION_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, ACCOUNT_TYPE, LANGUAGE, COUNTRY, GENDER, DOB, CURRENCY_BALANCE, PLATFORM);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a user creates an account\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadAccountCreate(CREATION_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, ACCOUNT_TYPE, LANGUAGE, COUNTRY, GENDER, DOB, CURRENCY_BALANCE, PLATFORM);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Delete Account (Event ID#10)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding account deletion, including reasoning for deletion, in terms of churn or account compromise. To log the deletion of an account you need to pass the account ID, churn type, and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn, Farming, Integrity)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHURN TYPE ||Yes ||Stopped||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user deletes an account\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadAccountDeleted(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHURN_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user deletes an account\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''loadAccountDelete(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHURN_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a user deletes an account\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadAccount''Delete(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHURN_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Create Character (Event ID#11)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Relates to the creation of characters or aliases within the game, where the character's attributes may vary from the attributes of the person in the real world. Once a character is created their attributes are usually fixed. To log a character creation, you need to pass the character and account IDs; the character class, subclass, gender, race, and name; the shard ID; along with the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note''': You must log the character creation information before any log or load command references the character ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER CLASS || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER SUBCLASS || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER GENDER || Yes || NA||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER RACE || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER NAME || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log the creation of a character\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadCharacterCreate(TIMESTAMP, CHARACTER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_CLASS, CHARACTER_SUBCLASS, CHARACTER_GENDER, CHARACTER_RACE, CHARACTER_NAME, SHARD_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log the creation of a character\\ aKApi.''loadCharacterCreate(TIMESTAMP, CHARACTER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_CLASS, CHARACTER_SUBCLASS, CHARACTER_GENDER, CHARACTER_RACE, CHARACTER_NAME, SHARD_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log the creation of a character\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadCharacterCreate(TIMESTAMP, CHARACTER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_CLASS, CHARACTER_SUBCLASS, CHARACTER_GENDER, CHARACTER_RACE, CHARACTER_NAME, SHARD_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Delete Character (Event ID#12)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the deletion of a character. To log a character deletion, you need to pass the character ID, account ID, and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For related information, see [[#_bookmark41 | Create Character.]]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log the deletion of a character\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadCharacterDelete(TIMESTAMP, CHARACTER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log the deletion of a character\\ aKApi.''loadCharacterDelete(TIMESTAMP, CHARACTER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log the deletion of a character\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadCharacterDelete(TIMESTAMP, CHARACTER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Integrity (Event ID#48)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Integrity indicates whether an account has been compromised. This event records information regarding when the account was compromised and what type of integrity violation occurred. To log the integrity of an account you need to pass the account ID, integrity type, and timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the shard ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Integrity)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time)||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || No || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || INTEGRITY TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log account integrity\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logIntegrity(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, SHARD_ID, INTEGRITY_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log account integrity\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logIntegrity(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, SHARD_ID, INTEGRITY_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log account integrity\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logIntegrity(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, SHARD_ID, INTEGRITY_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Game Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Game events include those events that are related to in-game characters, actions, and combat. Details on how to execute calls to log game events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Begin Combat (Event ID#21)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the beginning of combat between a player and a non-player character (NPC). To log when a player begins combat, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the NPC ID; the area ID, name and position; as well as the timestamp.
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || NPC ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || BEGIN AREA ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || BEGIN POSITION X || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || BEGIN POSITION Y || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || BEGIN POSITION Z || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || BEGIN AREA NAME || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || BEGIN COMBAT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a combat event begins\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logCombatBegin(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_ID, BEGIN_AREA_ID, BEGIN_POSITION_X, BEGIN_POSITION_Y, BEGIN_POSITION_Z, BEGIN_AREA_NAME, BEGIN_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a combat event begins\\ aKApi.''logCombatBegin(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_ID, BEGIN_AREA_ID, BEGIN_POSITION_X, BEGIN_POSITION_Y, BEGIN_POSITION_Z, BEGIN_AREA_NAME, BEGIN_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a combat event begins\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logCombatBegin(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_ID, BEGIN_AREA_ID, BEGIN_POSITION_X, BEGIN_POSITION_Y, BEGIN_POSITION_Z,BEGIN_AREA_NAME, BEGIN_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''End Combat (Event ID#22)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the end of combat between a player and a non- player character (NPC). To log when a player ends combat, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the NPC ID; the area ID, name, and position; as well as the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || NPC ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || END AREA ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || END POSITION X || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || END POSITION Y || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || END POSITION Z || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || END AREA NAME || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || END COMBAT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a combat event ends\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logCombatEnd(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_ID, END_AREA_ID, END_POSITION_X, END_POSITION_Y, END_POSITION_Z, END_AREA_NAME, END_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a combat event ends\\ aKApi.''logCombatEnd(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_ID, END_AREA_ID, END_POSITION_X, END_POSITION_Y, END_POSITION_Z, END_AREA_NAME, END_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when a combat event ends\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logCombatEnd(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_ID, END_AREA_ID, END_POSITION_X, END_POSITION_Y, END_POSITION_Z, END_AREA_NAME, END_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Kill (NPC) (Event ID#23)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records when a non-player character (NPC) is killed by a player in the game. To log an NPC kill, you need to pass the account and character ID, the killed NPC ID, and the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the character level and shard ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || No || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || CHARACTER LEVEL || Yes || If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0.||
							Element:br
								|| String || KILLED NPC ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || BEGIN COMBAT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when an NPC is killed\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''NPCKill(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, KILLED_NPC_ID, BEGIN_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when an NPC is killed\\ aKApi.log''NPCKill(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID,
							Element:br
								CHARACTER_LEVEL, KILLED_NPC_ID, BEGIN_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log when an NPC is killed\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''NPCKill(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, KILLED_NPC_ID, BEGIN_COMBAT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Player Points (Event ID#24)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding when a player gains points in the game. Points are used as an indicator of how well the player is doing in the game and how far they have progressed. Typically, gaining enough points leads the player to level-up to a higher level. To log player points, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the character level, the point amount, along with the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the shard ID and whether or not the points are grouped.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||XP TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0.||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||No ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||XP AMOUNT ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Boolean ||GROUPED FLAG ||No|| N||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Point Type default is XP, alternate options include 'Generic Point', and 'Other'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log player XP\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''playerXp(XP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, XP_AMOUNT, GROUPED_FLAG);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log player XP\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''playerXp(XP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, XP_AMOUNT, GROUPED_FLAG
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log player XP\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''playerXp(XP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, XP_AMOUNT, GROUPED_FLAG);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Player Versus Player (PVP) Duel (Event ID#25)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information when a player enters into combat against another player. Note that this event is only applicable for games and environments where a player is able to fight another player. To log a PVP duel, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, the timestamp, and whether or not the player won.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || PVP DUEL TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Boolean || WIN FLAG || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a PVP Duel\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''PvpDuel(PVP_DUEL_TIMESTAMP ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, WIN_FLAG);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a PVP Duel\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.log''PvpDuel(PVP_DUEL_TIMESTAMP ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, WIN_FLAG);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a PVP Duel\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''PvpDuel(PVP_DUEL_TIMESTAMP ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, WIN_FLAG);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Player Death (Event ID#26)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the death of a player by a non-player character (NPC). To log a player death, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the Area ID and name; the NPC ID; the position; the type of death; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || DEATH TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || KILLER NPC ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' v
							Element:br
								|| String || DEATH TYPE || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || AREA ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || POSITION X || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || POSITION Y || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || POSITION Z || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || AREA NAME || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a player death\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logPlayerDeath(DEATH_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, KILLER_NPC_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, DEATH_TYPE, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log a player death\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logPlayerDeath(DEATH_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, KILLER_NPC_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, DEATH_TYPE, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log a player death\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logPlayerDeath(DEATH_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, KILLER_NPC_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, DEATH_TYPE, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Non-Player Character (NPC) (Event ID#31)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Non-player characters (NPCs) are characters within the game that are not controlled by players. They have different levels of difficulty and may be either friendly or aggressive. This event records information regarding interactions between NPCs and players in the game environment. Recording NPC's also populates the dimension table for NPCs, which is later referred to for all other NPC related events. To log NPC events, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the NPC ID, name, and type; the minimum and maximum levels; the event type and name; along with the toughness and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (NPC)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EVENT TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||NPC EVENT NAME ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||NPC EVENT TYPE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||NPC ID ||Yes ||If NPC ID is empty, and NPC Name is not empty, use 0.||
							Element:br
								||String ||NPC NAME ||Yes ||If NPC ID is note empty, and NPC Name is empty, use NA.||
							Element:br
								||String ||NPC TYPE ||Yes ||Set as Optional, with Null value||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||MIN LEVEL ||Yes ||Set as Optional, with Null value||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||MAX LEVEL ||Yes ||Set as Optional, with Null value||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||TOUGHNESS ||Yes ||Set as Optional, with Null value||
							Element:br
								||String ||TOUGHNESS ENUM ||Yes|| Set as Optional, with Null value||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log an NPC event occurred\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''NpcInteraction(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_EVENT_NAME, NPC_EVENT_TYPE, NPC_ID, NPC_NAME, NPC_TYPE, MIN_LEVEL, MAX_LEVEL, TOUGHNESS, TOUGHNESS_ENUM);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log an NPC event occurred\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.log''NpcInteraction(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_EVENT_NAME, NPC_EVENT_TYPE, NPC_ID, NPC_NAME, NPC_TYPE, MIN_LEVEL, MAX_LEVEL, TOUGHNESS, TOUGHNESS_ENUM);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log an NPC event occurred\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''NpcInteraction(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, NPC_EVENT_NAME, NPC_EVENT_TYPE, NPC_ID, NPC_NAME, NPC_TYPE, MIN_LEVEL, MAX_LEVEL, TOUGHNESS, TOUGHNESS_ENUM);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Challenge (Event ID#32)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Challenges, sometimes referred to as Quests, are elements of the game where a player, or group of players, can perform tasks for a reward or opportunity to level-up within the game. This event records information regarding challenges. To log a challenge event, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the challenge ID, type, and status; along with the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHALLENGE ID || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHALLENGE TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHALLENGE STATUS || Yes || Accepted* ||
							Element:br
								[- *The Challenge Status default is 'Accepted', but alternate options include 'Completed', or 'Abandoned'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a challenge event occurred\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''Challenge(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHALLENGE_ID, CHALLENGE_TYPE, CHALLENGE_STATUS);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a challenge event occurred\\ aKApi.log''Challenge(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHALLENGE_ID, CHALLENGE_TYPE, CHALLENGE_STATUS);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a challenge event occurred\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''Challenge(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHALLENGE_ID, CHALLENGE_TYPE, CHALLENGE_STATUS);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Farmer (Event ID#47)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding whether or not a player is a gold farmer, including what type of gold farmer they are (e.g. spammer, gatherer, mule, etc.). To log whether a player is a gold farmer, you need to pass the account and character ID, the shard ID, the farmer type, and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Farming)

							Element:br

							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || FARMER TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br

							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''Farmer(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, FARMER_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Reward (Event ID#49)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding reward systems, through which rewards may be awarded for completion of a task or seniority. To log reward events, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the reward type, ID, and count; along with the shard ID and timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the reward item type.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || REWARD TYPE || Yes || ''No Default Value''* ||
							Element:br
								|| String || REWARD ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || ITEM TYPE || No || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| Float || REWARD COUNT || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[++ ++][-*The Reward Type must be 'Item' or 'Currency'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log that a reward event occurred\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''Reward(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, REWARD_TYPE, REWARD_ID, ITEM_TYPE, REWARD_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log that a reward event occurred\\ aKApi.log''Reward(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, REWARD_TYPE, REWARD_ID, ITEM_TYPE, REWARD_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log that a reward event occurred\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''Reward(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, REWARD_TYPE, REWARD_ID, ITEM_TYPE, REWARD_COUNTP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Mob (Event ID#51)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								A Mob refers to a group of non-player characters (NPCs). This event records information on when a player confronts and kills a Mob. To log a mob event, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, and the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the description of the kill.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Farming)
							Element:br

								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time)||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || KILL MOB DESCRIPTION || No || Null ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a mob is defeated\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''Mob(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, KILL_MOB_DESCRIPTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a mob is defeated\\ aKApi.log''Mob(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, KILL_MOB_DESCRIPTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a mob is defeated\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''Mob(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, KILL_MOB_DESCRIPTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Resource (Event ID#56)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								A resource event refers to when a player acquires a non-item resource within the game, such as coins, gold, power, etc. To log resource events, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the resource type, count, and ID; along with the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br

							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time)||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RESOURCE TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| String || RESOURCE ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								|| Long || RESOURCE COUNT || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br

							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''Resource(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, RESOURCE_TYPE, RESOURCE_ID, RESOURCE_COUNT);

							Element:br

								*PHP
							Element:br
