							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Item Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Item events include those events that are related to the creation, use, and transaction of in-game items. Details on how to execute calls to log item events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!!'''Initialize Item (Event ID#15)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding virtual items in the game. Such items may be made available by non-player characters, or they may be created by players in the game. Initializing an item also initializes the dimension table for the item, which is later referred to for all other item related events. To initialize an item, you need to pass the item ID, name, type, and segment, as well as the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the account and character IDs of the creator.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note''': You must log the item creation information before any log or load command references the item ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Items)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Long ||ITEM ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||ITEM NAME ||Yes ||NA||
							Element:br
								||String ||ITEM TYPE ||Yes ||Other ||
							Element:br
								||String ||ITEM SEGMENT ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CREATED BY ACCOUNT ID ||No ||If ITEM_SEGMENT=UGC, then Required.||
							Element:br
								||String ||CREATED BY CHARACTER ID ||No ||If ITEM_SEGMENT=UGC, then ACCOUNT_ID.||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log item creation information\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadInitItem(ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, ITEM_SEGMENT, CREATED_BY_ACCOUNT_ID, CREATED_BY, CHARACTER_ID, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log item creation information\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi''.loadInitItem(ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, ITEM_SEGMENT, CREATED_BY_ACCOUNT_ID, CREATED_BY, CHARACTER_ID, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log item creation information\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadInitItem(ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, ITEM_SEGMENT, CREATED_BY_ACCOUNT_ID, CREATED_BY, CHARACTER_ID, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Item Used (Event ID#16)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the usage of items in the game, such as the usage location, and includes account and character information for the user who used the item. To log an item's use, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the character level; the shard ID; the item ID, name, and count; the area ID, name, and position; as well as the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Items)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EVENT TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||ITEM ID ||Yes ||If ITEM_ID is empty and ITEM_NAME is not empty, use 0.||
							Element:br
								||String ||ITEM NAME ||Yes ||If ITEM_ID is not empty and ITEM_NAME is empty, use NA.||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||ITEM COUNT ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Long ||AREA ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||AREA NAME ||Yes ||NA||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION X ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION Y ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION Z ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log that an item was used\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logItem(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_COUNT, AREA_ID, AREA_NAME, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log that an item was used\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logItem(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_COUNT, AREA_ID, AREA_NAME, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log that an item was used\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logItem(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_COUNT, AREA_ID, AREA_NAME, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Item Transaction (Event ID#17)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the purchase of items in the game using either real world money or virtual currency that may be exclusive to the game. To log an item transaction, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the item ID, name, and price; the currency type and currency value; the transaction type; as well as the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the virtual currency type and count.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Churn)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||ITEM ID ||Yes ||If ITEM_ID is empty and ITEM_NAME is not empty, use 0.||
							Element:br
								||String ||ITEM NAME ||Yes ||If ITEM_ID is note empty and ITEM_NAME is empty, use NA.||
							Element:br
								||Float ||ITEM PRICE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||TRANSACTION TYPE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''*||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CURRENCY TYPE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''**||
							Element:br
								||String ||VIRTUAL CURRENCY TYPE ||No|| If CURRENCY_TYPE=1 then required; else null.||
							Element:br
								||Float ||CURRENCY VALUE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT ||No|| Null||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Transaction Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Spent' and 1 equals 'Acquired'.-]\\
							Element:br
								[- **Currency Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Real' and 1 equals 'Virtual Currency'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log that an item transaction occurred\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logItemTransaction(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_PRICE, TRANSACTION_TYPE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_TYPE, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log that an item transaction occurred\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logItemTransaction(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_PRICE, TRANSACTION_TYPE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_TYPE, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log that an item transaction occurred\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logItemTransaction(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_PRICE, TRANSACTION_TYPE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_TYPE, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''User Generated Content (UGC) Rating (Event ID#19)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the creation of in-game items and artifacts, including how items have been rated by other players. To log a UGC rating, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the item ID and name; the UGC rating; and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || ITEM ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ITEM NAME || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| VOID || UGC RATING || Yes || 1 ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || RATING TIMESTAMP || Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a UGC rating\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''UGCRating(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, UGC_RATING, RATING_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a UGC rating\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.log''UGCRating(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, UGC_RATING, RATING_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a UGC rating\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''UGCRating(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, UGC_RATING, RATING_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''User Generated Content (UGC) Copy (Event ID#46)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the copying of an in-game item that was created by another player, not including items built-in by the gaming company. To log when a UGC is copied, you need to pass the copier's account and character IDs; the shard ID; the item ID and name; along with the timestamp.
							Element:br
								For related information, see [[#_bookmark64 | User Generated Content (UGC) Rating.]]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || COPY ACCOUNT ID || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || COPY CHARACTER ID || Yes || COPY_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || ITEM ID || Yes || If Item ID is empty and Item Name is not empty, use 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ITEM NAME || Yes || If Item ID is not empty and Item Name is empty, use NA. ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || ITEM COPY TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when UGC is copied\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''UGCCopy(COPY_ACCOUNT_ID, COPY_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_COPY_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when UGC is copied\\ aKApi.log''UGCCopy(COPY_ACCOUNT_ID, COPY_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_COPY_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when UGC is copied\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''UGCCopy(COPY_ACCOUNT_ID, COPY_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_COPY_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Productivity (Event ID#55)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Productivity refers to events where players craft or harvest items within the game. To log productivity events, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, the productivity type, and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || PRODUCTIVITY TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a productivity event occurred\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''Productivity(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, PRODUCTIVITY_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a productivity event occurred\\ aKApi.log''Productivity(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, PRODUCTIVITY_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a productivity event occurred\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''Productivity(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, PRODUCTIVITY_TYPE););
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Group Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Group events include those events involving player interaction with a group or guild, such as entry, exit, or a player's position within a guild (e.g. Guild Leader). A guild is analogous to an organization in many online games. Details on how to execute calls to log group events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Group Enter (Event ID#4)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records the time at which a user joins a group. In this case, groups are likely to be impermanent. Note that grouping is not applicable for solo games. To log a user's entry into a group you need to pass the account, character, shard, and group IDs; the character level, and timestamp of entry.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Social) - Optional
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || ENTER GROUP TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long vCHARACTER LEVEL || Yes || If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || GROUP ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a user enters a group\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logEnterGroup(ENTER_GROUP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GROUP_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a user enters a group\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logEnterGroup(ENTER_GROUP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GROUP_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a user enters a group\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logEnterGroup(ENTER_GROUP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GROUP_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Group Exit (Event ID#5)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records the time at which a user leaves a group. To log a user's exit from a group you need to pass the account, character, shard, and group IDs; the character level; and timestamp of exit.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For related information, see [[#_bookmark69 | Group Enter.]]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Social) - Optional
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || LEAVE GROUP TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || CHARACTER LEVEL || Yes || If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || GROUP ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a user exits a group\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logExitGroup(LEAVE_GROUP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GROUP_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a user exits a group\\ aKApi.''logExitGroup(LEAVE_GROUP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GROUP_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a user exits a group\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logExitGroup(LEAVE_GROUP_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GROUP_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Enter Guild Event ID#41)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding when a player becomes part of a guild and whether they are the leader of the guild, or not. To log a player's entry into a guild, you need to pass the user's account ID, character ID, shard ID, guild ID, along with the time of entry. Optionally, you can pass their character level.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' v
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes|| ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || CHARACTER LEVEL || No || If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || GUILD ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player enters a guild\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logEnterGuild(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GUILD_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player enters a guild\\ ''aKApi.''logEnterGuild(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GUILD_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player enters a guild\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logEnterGuild(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GUILD_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Exit Guild (Event ID#42)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding exiting a guild, including the guild exited and reason for leaving such as being evicted, leaving voluntarily, etc. To log a player's exit from a guild, you need to pass the user's account ID, character ID, shard ID, guild ID, along with the time of entry and reason for exiting the guild. Optionally, you can pass their character level.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								|| Long || CHARACTER LEVEL || No || If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of Levels then 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || GUILD ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || GUILD EXIT REASON || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when and why a player exits a guild\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logExitGuild(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GUILD_ID, GUILD_EXIT_REASON);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when and why a player exits a guild\\ ''aKApi.''logExitGuild(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GUILD_ID, GUILD_EXIT_REASON);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when and why a player exits a guild\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logExitGuild(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, GUILD_ID, GUILD_EXIT_REASON);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Guild Leader (Event ID#45)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding a player's position within a guild (i.e. whether they are the leader of a guild, and if so, which guild). To log if a player is a guild leader, you need to pass the user's account ID, character ID, guild ID, along with the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || GUILD ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) v
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log if a player is a guild leader\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''GuildLeader(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, GUILD_ID, EVENT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log if a player is a guild leader\\ ''aKApi.log''GuildLeader(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, GUILD_ID, EVENT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log if a player is a guild leader\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''GuildLeader(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, GUILD_ID, EVENT_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Environment Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Environment events include those events that are related to in-game levels and areas that players may encounter. Details on how to execute calls to log environment events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Level Begin (Event ID#27)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the time at which a player begins a level. To log when a player begins a level, you need to pass the account and character ID, the shard ID, the character level, the area ID and position, and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Note that if there is no concept of levels in your application this event need not be used.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||LEVEL BEGIN TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||If Generic Character then Account Level.||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||AREA ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION X ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION Y ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION Z ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||AREA NAME ||Yes ||NA||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player begins a level\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''levelBegin(LEVEL_BEGIN_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player begins a level\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''levelBegin(LEVEL_BEGIN_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player begins a level\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''levelBegin(LEVEL_BEGIN_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Level End (Event ID#28)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the time at which a player ends or completes a level. To log when a player ends a level, you need to pass the account and character ID, the shard ID, the character level, the area ID and position, and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Note that if there is no concept of levels in your application this event need not be used.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||LEVEL END TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||If Generic Character then Account Level.||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||AREA ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION X ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION Y ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||POSITION Z ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||AREA NAME ||Yes ||NA||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player ends a level\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''levelEnd(LEVEL_END_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player ends a level\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''levelEnd(LEVEL_END_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player ends a level\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''levelEnd(LEVEL_END_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, POSITION_X, POSITION_Y, POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Enter Area (Event ID#29)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								An Area refers to a geographical area or region that makes up a larger virtual world. This event records information regarding the time at which a player enters an area. To log when a player enters an area, you need to pass the account and character IDs; shard ID; area ID, level, and position; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI - Optional
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Location/Maps)
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Farming)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||AREA ID ||Yes ||If AREA_ID is not empty, and AREA_NAME is empty, set AREA_NAME=NA.||
							Element:br
								||Long ||ENTER AREA LEVEL ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Float ||ENTER POSITION X ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||ENTER POSITION Y ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||ENTER POSITION Z ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String|| AREA NAME ||Yes ||If AREA_ID is not empty, and AREA_NAME is empty, set AREA_NAME=NA.||
							Element:br
								||Date|| ENTER AREA TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player enters an area\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''AreaEnter(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, ENTER_AREA_LEVEL, ENTER_POSITION_X, ENTER_POSITION_Y, ENTER_POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME, ENTER_AREA_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player enters an area\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.log''AreaEnter(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, ENTER_AREA_LEVEL, ENTER_POSITION_X, ENTER_POSITION_Y, ENTER_POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME, ENTER_AREA_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player enters an area\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''AreaEnter(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, ENTER_AREA_LEVEL, ENTER_POSITION_X, ENTER_POSITION_Y, ENTER_POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME, ENTER_AREA_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Exit Area (Event ID#30)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the time at which a player exits an area. To log when a player exits an area, you need to pass the account and character IDs; the shard ID; the area level, position, and ID; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For related information, see ''Enter Area''.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI - Optional
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels, Location/Maps)
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Farming)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EXIT AREA TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||AREA ID ||Yes|| If AREA_ID is not empty, and AREA_NAME is empty, set AREA_NAME=NA.||
							Element:br
								||Float ||EXIT POSITION X ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||EXIT POSITION Y ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Float ||EXIT POSITION Z ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||AREA NAME ||Yes ||If AREA_ID is not empty, and AREA_NAME is empty, set AREA_NAME=NA.||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player exits an area\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''AreaExit(EXIT_AREA_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, EXIT_POSITION_X, EXIT_POSITION_Y, EXIT_POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player exits an area\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.log''AreaExit(EXIT_AREA_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, EXIT_POSITION_X, EXIT_POSITION_Y, EXIT_POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player exits an area\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''AreaExit(EXIT_AREA_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, SHARD_ID, AREA_ID, EXIT_POSITION_X, EXIT_POSITION_Y, EXIT_POSITION_Z, AREA_NAME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Area Dim (Event ID#50)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For games with geographical areas and maps that make up a larger virtual world, this event records the dimension information about these maps. To log area dimensions, you need to pass the area name and ID, the map label and ID, the min and max positions, as well as the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || AREA NAME || Yes || If AREA_ID is not empty, and AREA_NAME is empty, set AREA_NAME=NA. ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || AREA ID || Yes || If AREA_ID is empty, and AREA_NAME is not empty, set AREA_ID=0. ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || MAP ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || MAP LABEL || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || MIN X || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || MIN Y || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || MIN Z || No || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || MAX X || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || MAX Y || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || MAX Z || No || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log area dimensions\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.load''AreaDim(AREA_NAME, AREA_ID, MAP_ID, MAP_LABEL, MIN_X, MIN_Y, MIN_Z, MAX_X, MAX_Y, MAX_Z, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log area dimensions\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.load''AreaDim(AREA_NAME, AREA_ID, MAP_ID, MAP_LABEL, MIN_X, MIN_Y, MIN_Z, MAX_X, MAX_Y, MAX_Z, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log area dimensions\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->load''AreaDim(AREA_NAME, AREA_ID, MAP_ID, MAP_LABEL, MIN_X, MIN_Y, MIN_Z, MAX_X, MAX_Y, MAX_Z, TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Economic Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Economic events include those events that are related to in-game stores and purchases, such as a player's interaction with a store and items within it. Details on how to execute calls to log economic events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Initialize Virtual Currency (Event ID#14)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding which currencies players can use in exchange for in-game virtual items or resources. Typically, virtual currencies have an exchange rate that captures their corresponding value in real world currency, such as US Dollars, Yen, Euros, etc. To log virtual currencies, you need to pass the virtual currency label and exchange rate.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||VIRTUAL CURRENCY LABEL ||Yes || ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log virtual currency\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''loadVirtualCurrency(TIMESTAMP, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_LABEL);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log virtual currency\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''loadVirtualCurrency(TIMESTAMP, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_LABEL);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log virtual currency\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''loadVirtualCurrency(TIMESTAMP, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_LABEL);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Store Create (Event ID#35)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For games that allow players to setup an in-game store where they can sell items, this event records information regarding the creation of an in-game store. To log when a store is created, you need to pass the store ID and description, as well as the address, city, state, country, zip code, and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note''': You must log the store creation information before any log or load command references the store ID.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || UPDATED TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || STORE ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || STORE DESCRIPTION || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ADDRESS || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CITY || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || STATE || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || COUNTRY || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ZIPCODE || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a store is created\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''storeCreate(UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, STORE_ID, STORE_DESCRIPTION, ADDRESS, CITY, STATE, COUNTRY, ZIPCODE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a store is created\\
							Element:br
								aKApi.''storeCreate(UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, STORE_ID, STORE_DESCRIPTION, ADDRESS, CITY, STATE, COUNTRY, ZIPCODE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a store is created\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''storeCreate(UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, STORE_ID, STORE_DESCRIPTION, ADDRESS, CITY, STATE, COUNTRY, ZIPCODE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Store Delete (Event ID#36)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the deletion of an in-game store. To log when a store is deleted, you need to pass the store ID and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For related information, see [[#_bookmark81 | Store Create.]]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || UPDATED TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || STORE ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a store is deleted\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''StoreDelete(UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, STORE_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a store is deleted\\ aKApi.''StoreDelete(UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, STORE_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a store is deleted\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''StoreDelete(UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, STORE_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Buy Store Item (Event ID#37)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding item purchases from an in-game store and includes details on the type of currency used. To log when a player buys a store item, you need to pass the account, character, and store IDs; the shard ID; the recipient account and character IDs; the item ID, name, and price; the currency type and value; and the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the name of the virtual currency.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EVENT TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECIPIENT ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECIPIENT CHARACER ID ||Yes ||RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Long ||STORE ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Long ||ITEM ID ||Yes ||If Item ID is empty and Item Name is not empty, use 0.||
							Element:br
								||String ||ITEM NAME ||Yes ||If Item ID is not empty and Item Name is empty, use NA.||
							Element:br
								||Float ||ITEM PRICE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CURRENCY TYPE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''*||
							Element:br
								||String ||VITRUAL CURRENCY NAME ||No|| If Currency Type is 1 then mandatory, else NULL.||
							Element:br
								||Float ||CURRENCY VALUE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT ||No ||Null||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Currency Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Real' and 1 equals 'Virtual Currency'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player buys a store item\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''storeBuyItem(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIPIENT_CHARACER_ID, SHARD_ID, STORE_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_PRICE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_NAME, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player buys a store item\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''storeBuyItem(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIPIENT_CHARACER_ID, SHARD_ID, STORE_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_PRICE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_NAME, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player buys a store item\\
							Element:br
								$aKApi->storeBuyItem(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIPIENT_CHARACER_ID, SHARD_ID, STORE_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_PRICE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_NAME, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Store Login (Event ID#38)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the time at which a player logs in to an in-game virtual store. To log when a player logs into a store, you need to pass the account, character, and store IDs; the shard ID; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || STORE ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player logs in to a store\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logStoreLogin(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, STORE_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log when a player logs in to a store\\ aKApi.''logStoreLogin(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, STORE_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log when a player logs in to a store\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logStoreLogin(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, STORE_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Store Logout (Event ID#39)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding the time at which a player logs out of an in- game virtual store. To log when a player logs out of a store, you need to pass the account, character, and store IDs; the shard ID; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || STORE ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br

							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Store Selection / Add to Cart (Event ID#40)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding when an item is selected or added to a player's cart. Note that this event may be a pre-requisite for buying an item; however it is not the same as buying an item. To log when a player selects a store item, you need to pass the account, character, and store IDs; the item name, type, and ID; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || STORE ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || ITEM ID || Yes || If Item ID is empty and Item Name is not empty, use 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ITEM NAME || Yes || If Item ID is not empty and Item Name is empty, use NA. ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ITEM TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| Date || SELECTION TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log when a player selects a store item\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''StoreSelection(STORE_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, SELECTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br

							Element:br

							Element:br
