							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Transaction Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Transaction events include those events that are related to economic events outside of the game, such as when an item is purchased outside of the developer game store, or when a subscription changes.
							Element:br
								Details on how to execute calls to log transaction events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Subscription Change (Event ID#3)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records a change in subscription type (e.g. from free play to a paid subscriber or premium player). Subscription changes are only applicable to games with subscriptions, not free-to-play (F2P) games. To log a change of subscription, you need to pass the user's account ID, subscription status and type, and a timestamp for both subscription and expiry. Optionally, you can also pass the subscription value.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Items, Levels, Social, NPC, Location/Maps)
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn, Farming, Integrity)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||SUBSCRIPTION TIMESTAMP|| Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID|| Yes|| ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||SUBSCRIPTION STATUS|| Yes|| Active||
							Element:br
								||String ||SUBSCRIPTION TYPE|| Yes ||Paid||
							Element:br
								||Float ||SUBSCRIPTION VALUE|| No|| ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||Date ||SUBSCRIPTION EXPIRED TIMESTAMP|| Yes ||(Month From Subscription Date)||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log a change of subscription\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''putSubChange(SUBSCRIPTION_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, SUBSCRIPTION_STATUS, SUBSCRIPTION_TYPE, SUBSCRIPTION_VALUE, SUBSCRIPTION_EXPIRED_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log a change of subscription\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''putSubChange(SUBSCRIPTION_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, SUBSCRIPTION_STATUS, SUBSCRIPTION_TYPE, SUBSCRIPTION_VALUE, SUBSCRIPTION_EXPIRED_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log a change of subscription\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''putSubChange(SUBSCRIPTION_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, SUBSCRIPTION_STATUS, SUBSCRIPTION_TYPE, SUBSCRIPTION_VALUE, SUBSCRIPTION_EXPIRED_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Currency Transaction (Event ID#18)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding transactions in the game or other environments where real world money is used. To log currency transactions, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, the transaction and currency types, as well as the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the virtual currency label, the currency value, and the transaction description.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*User Metrics (Churn)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EVENT TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||TRANSACTION TYPE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''*||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CURRENCY TYPE ||Yes ||''No Default Value''**||
							Element:br
								||String ||VIRTUAL CURRENCY LABEL ||No ||If CURRENCY_TYPE=1 then required; else null.||
							Element:br
								||Float ||CURRENCY VALUE ||No ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||TRANSACTION DESCRIPTION ||No ||Truncate if >200||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT ||No ||Null||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Transaction Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Spent' and 1 equals 'Acquired'.-]\\
							Element:br
								[- **Currency Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Real' and 1 equals 'Virtual Currency'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a currency transaction\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logCurrencyTransaction(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, TRANSACTION_TYPE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_LABEL, CURRENCY_VALUE, TRANSACTION_DESCRIPTION, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a currency transaction\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logCurrencyTransaction(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, TRANSACTIO_ TYPE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_LABEL, CURRENCY_VALUE, TRANSACTION_DESCRIPTION, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a currency transaction\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logCurrencyTransaction(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, TRANSACTION_TYPE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_LABEL, CURRENCY_VALUE, TRANSACTION_DESCRIPTION, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Economic (Event ID#58)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding item purchases, sales, or trades outside of the developer RMT game store. This event requires both an incoming and outgoing value, of which either can be 0. To log an economic event, you need to pass the sender and receiver account and character IDs; the shard ID; the item name and ID; the economic type and value; the currency type and value; along with the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the virtual currency type and count.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || SENDER ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || SENDER CHARACTER ID || Yes || SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECEIVER CHARACTER ID || Yes || RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 v
							Element:br
								|| Long || ITEM ID || Yes || If Item ID is empty and Item Name is not empty, use 0. ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ITEM NAME || Yes || If Item ID is not empty and Item Name is empty, use NA. ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ECONOMIC TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| Float || ECONOMIC VALUE || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CURRENCY TYPE || Yes || ''No Default Value'' * ||
							Element:br
								|| String || VIRTUAL CURRENCY TYPE || No || If CURRENCY_TYPE=1 then required; else null. ||
							Element:br
								|| Float || CURRENCY VALUE || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Integer || VIRTUAL CURRENCY COUNT || No || Null ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Currency Type must be 0 or 1, where 0 equals 'Real' and 1 equals 'Virtual Currency'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//To log that an economic event occurred\\ ''public void ''aKApi.''Economic(TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ECONOMIC_TYPE, ECONOMIC_VALUE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_TYPE, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT) ;
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//To log that an economic event occurred\\ aKApi.''Economic(TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ECONOMIC_TYPE, ECONOMIC_VALUE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_TYPE, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//To log that an economic event occurred\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''Economic(TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_NAME, ECONOMIC_TYPE, ECONOMIC_VALUE, CURRENCY_TYPE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_TYPE, CURRENCY_VALUE, VIRTUAL_CURRENCY_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Payment (Event ID#59)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding payments for the game using alternate methods such as game cards redeemed online or virtual purchases from an offline store.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Social Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Social events include social interactions between players in and outside of the game such as messages, off-game-interactions, friend requests, etc. Details on how to execute calls to log social events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Social (Event ID#6)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records social events involving two people and includes all social events that are not covered as ''Group (Entry/Exit) Events ''or ''Friend (Addition/Deletion) Events''. To log an in-app social event, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs; the receiver account and character IDs; the shard ID; the character levels of both users; the social event name; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Social)
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EVENT TIMESTAMP|| Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of levels then 0.||
							Element:br
								||String ||TARGET ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||TARGET CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||TARGET_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Integer ||TARGET CHARACTER LEVEL ||Yes ||If Generic Character then Account Level; If no concept of levels then 0.||
							Element:br
								||String ||SOCIAL EVENTS NAME|| Yes|| ''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||SOCIAL EVENT TYPE|| Yes ||Other ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log an in-app social event\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logSocialEvent(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, TARGET_ACCOUNT_ID, TARGET_CHARACTER_ID, TARGET_CHARACTER_LEVEL, SOCIAL_EVENTS_NAME, SOCIAL_EVENT_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								**JavaScript
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log an in-app social event[[<<]]
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logSocialEvent(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, TARGET_ACCOUNT_ID, TARGET_CHARACTER_ID, TARGET_CHARACTER_LEVEL, SOCIAL_EVENTS_NAME, SOCIAL_EVENT_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								**PHP
							Element:br
							Element:br
								//Log an in-app social event\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logSocialEvent(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHARACTER_LEVEL, TARGET_ACCOUNT_ID, TARGET_CHARACTER_ID, TARGET_CHARACTER_LEVEL, SOCIAL_EVENTS_NAME, SOCIAL_EVENT_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Off-Game-Interaction (OGI) Sender (Event ID#7)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								An off-game-interaction refers to an interaction between a player inside the game environment and a person outside the game environment. To log the start of a social interaction outside of the application, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs; the receiver account and character IDs; the shard ID; the interaction category and location; and the event timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || SENDER ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || SENDER CHARACTER ID || Yes || SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''* ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECEIVER CHARACTER ID || Yes || RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || OGI LOCATION || Yes || Other ||
							Element:br
								|| String || OGI CATEGORY || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Receiver Account ID can be an ID (e.g. Facebook or Email).-]
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log the start of an off-game-interaction\\ ''public void ''aKApi.''logOgiSend(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, OGI_LOCATION, OGI_CATEGORY);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log the start of an off-game-interaction\\ aKApi.''logOgiSend(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, OGI_LOCATION, OGI_CATEGORY);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log the start of an off-game-interaction\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logOgiSend(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, OGI_LOCATION, OGI_CATEGORY);
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Off-Game-Interaction (OGI) Receiver (Event ID#8)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding how the receiver of an off-game-interaction acted in response. To log the receiver's response to a social interaction outside of the application, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs, along with the receiver account and character IDs, shard ID, and event timestamp. As well, you'll need to pass the interaction category, location, and receiver response.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For related information, see [[#_bookmark99 | Off-Game-Interaction Sender]].
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || SENDER ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || SENDER CHARACTER ID || Yes || SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value''* ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECEIVER CHARACTER ID || Yes || RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || OGI LOCATION || Yes || Other ||
							Element:br
								|| String || OGI CATEGORY || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || OGI RECEIVER ACTION || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Receiver Account ID can be an ID (e.g. Facebook or Email).-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								// Log the end of and response to an off-game-interaction\\ ''public void ''aKApi.''logOgiRecv(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, OGI_LOCATION, OGI_CATEGORY, OGI_RECEIVER_ACTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								// Log the end of and response to an off-game-interaction\\ aKApi.''logOgiRecv(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, OGI_LOCATION, OGI_CATEGORY, OGI_RECEIVER_ACTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								// Log the end of and response to an off-game-interaction\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''logOgiRecv(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECEIVER_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, OGI_LOCATION, OGI_CATEGORY, OGI_RECEIVER_ACTION);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!!'''Message (Event ID#20)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records in-game messages between players for multiple channels of communication such as in-game chat, in-game mail, or a message broadcast to a group. To log an in-game message, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs; the receiver account and character IDs; the shard ID; the channel label; the message character count; and the timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the message description.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||EVENT TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||FROM ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||FROM CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||FROM_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||String ||TO ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||TO CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||TO_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||Long ||SHARD ID ||Yes ||0||
							Element:br
								||String ||CHANNEL LABEL ||Yes ||Other ||
							Element:br
								||String ||MESSAGE DESCRIPTION ||No ||Null||
							Element:br
								||Long ||CHAR COUNT ||Yes ||1||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log an in-game message\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logMessage(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, FROM_ACCOUNT_ID, FROM_CHARACTER_ID, TO_ACCOUNT_ID, TO_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHANNEL_LABEL, MESSAGE_DESCRIPTION, CHAR_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log an in-game message\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''logMessage(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, FROM_ACCOUNT_ID, FROM_CHARACTER_ID, TO_ACCOUNT_ID, TO_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHANNEL_LABEL, MESSAGE_DESCRIPTION, CHAR_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log an in-game message\\
							Element:br
								$aKApi->logMessage(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, FROM_ACCOUNT_ID, FROM_CHARACTER_ID, TO_ACCOUNT_ID, TO_CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CHANNEL_LABEL, MESSAGE_DESCRIPTION, CHAR_COUNT);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!!'''Recruitment Send (Event ID#33)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For games that allow players to invite other players to join them in finishing certain tasks or activities, this event records information regarding the recruitment request. To log a recruitment request, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs; the receiver account and character IDs; the recruitment type; and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||SENDER ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||SENDER CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECEIVER CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECRUITMENT TYPE ||Yes ||Other ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a recruitment request\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''recruitmentSend(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECIEVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIEVER_CHARACTER_ID, RECRUITMENT_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a recruitment request\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''recruitmentSend(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECIEVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIEVER_CHARACTER_ID, RECRUITMENT_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a recruitment request\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''recruitmentSend(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECIEVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIEVER_CHARACTER_ID, RECRUITMENT_TYPE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Recruitment Receive Action (Event ID#34)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding a player's response to a recruitment request, for example, was the request accepted or declined. To log a recruitment request response, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs; the receiver account and character IDs; the recruitment type and outcome; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For related information, see ''Recruitment Send''.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*Basic Package (Summary)
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								||Date ||TIMESTAMP ||Yes ||(Current Time)||
							Element:br
								||String ||SENDER ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||SENDER CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECEIVER ACCOUNT ID ||Yes ||''No Default Value''||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECEIVER CHARACTER ID ||Yes ||RECEIVER_ACCOUNT_ID||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECRUITMENT TYPE ||Yes ||Other ||
							Element:br
								||String ||RECRUITMENT OUTCOME ||Yes ||Rejected*||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								[- *Recruitment Outcome default is 'Rejected', alternate options also include 'Accepted'.-]
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a recruitment request response\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''recruitmentReceive(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECIEVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIEVER_CHARACTER_ID, RECRUITMENT_TYPE, RECRUITMENT_OUTCOME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a recruitment request response\\
							Element:br
								''aKApi.''recruitmentReceive(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECIEVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIEVER_CHARACTER_ID, RECRUITMENT_TYPE, RECRUITMENT_OUTCOME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a recruitment request response\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->''recruitmentReceive(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, SENDER_ACCOUNT_ID, SENDER_CHARACTER_ID, RECIEVER_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIEVER_CHARACTER_ID, RECRUITMENT_TYPE, RECRUITMENT_OUTCOME);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Friend Addition (Event ID#43)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event records information regarding a player adding another player as a friend, despite whether the friendship is reciprocated. To log a friend addition, you need to pass the sender account and character IDs; the receiver account and character IDs; and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*System Metrics (Levels)
							Element:br

							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || EVENT TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECIPIENT ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || RECIPIENT CHARACTER ID || Yes || RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a friend addition\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.''logFriendAdd(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIPIENT_CHARACTER_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a friend addition\\ aKApi.''logFriendAdd(EVENT_TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_ID, RECIPIENT_CHARACTER_ID);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br

							Element:br

							Element:br

								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Custom Events'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Custom events include those events that relate to custom actions and CRM actions. As a Ninja Metrics customer, you have the freedom to define custom events in any way that you want, given the fields described under the ''Custom Slot Action ''and ''Custom Action ''events below. Details on how to execute calls to log custom events can be found below for each corresponding event.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''CRM Action (Event ID#52)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								A Customer Relationship Management (CRM) action may be taken by a CRM representative in the gaming company and recorded using this generic field. This event records information regarding how the customer responds to the action. To log a CRM action and response, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, the CRM action; and the action type and timestamp. Optionally, you may pass the outcome status and timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || CRM FULFILLED TIMESTAMP || No || Null ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CRM ACTION || Yes || NA ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CRM ACTION TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| String || CRM FULFILLED STATUS || No || Null ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || CRM ACTION TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a CRM action and response\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''CRMAction(CRM_FULFILLED_TIMESTAMP ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CRM_ACTION, CRM_ACTION_TYPE, CRM_FULFILLED_STATUS, CRM_ACTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a CRM action and response\\ aKApi.log''CRMAction(CRM_FULFILLED_TIMESTAMP ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CRM_ACTION, CRM_ACTION_TYPE, CRM_FULFILLED_STATUS, CRM_ACTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a CRM action and response\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''CRMAction(CRM_FULFILLED_TIMESTAMP ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CRM_ACTION, CRM_ACTION_TYPE, CRM_FULFILLED_STATUS, CRM_ACTION_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Custom Slot Action (Event ID#53)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event can be defined by your organization and records information regarding in- game events that are not described in any of the other events. To log a custom slot action event, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the shard ID, the action, type, and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| Long || SHARD ID || Yes || 0 ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CS ACTION || Yes || No Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CS ACTION TYPE || Yes || Other (See Appendix A for more types)||
							Element:br
								|| Date || CS TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, JavaScript, PHP, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a custom slot action event\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''CustomSlotAction(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CS_ACTION, CS_ACTION_TYPE, CS_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a custom slot action event\\ aKApi.log''CustomSlotAction(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CS_ACTION, CS_ACTION_TYPE, CS_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a custom slot action event\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''CustomSlotAction(ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CS_ACTION, CS_ACTION_TYPE, CS_TIMESTAMP);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Custom Slot (Event ID#54)'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								This event can be defined by your organization and records information regarding events that are not described in any of the other events and do not relate to actions in the game. To log a custom action event, you need to pass the account and character IDs, the custom action, the action type, the action value, and the timestamp.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Impacted UI Features'''+'
							Element:br
								*KPI
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Parameters'''+'
							Element:br
								|| border=1 rules=rows frame=hsides
							Element:br
								||! Type ||! Parameter ||! Required ||! Default Value ||
							Element:br
								|| Date || TIMESTAMP || Yes || (Current Time) ||
							Element:br
								|| String || ACCOUNT ID || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CHARACTER ID || Yes || ACCOUNT_ID ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CUSTOM ACTION || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| String || CUSTOM ACTION TYPE || Yes || ''No Default Value'' ||
							Element:br
								|| Integer(max 200) || CUSTOM ACTION VALUE || Yes || NA||
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'''Note: This event has not yet been implemented for Java, and iOS.'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								'+'''Sample Use'''+'
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Java
							Element:br
								//Log a custom action event\\
							Element:br
								public void ''aKApi.log''CustomAction(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CUSTOM_ACTION, CUSTOM_ACTION_TYPE, CUSTOM_ACTION_VALUE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*JavaScript
							Element:br
								//Log a custom action event\\ aKApi.log''CustomAction(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CUSTOM_ACTION, CUSTOM_ACTION_TYPE, CUSTOM_ACTION_VALUE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*PHP
							Element:br
								//Log a custom action event\\
							Element:br
								''$aKApi->log''CustomAction(TIMESTAMP, ACCOUNT_ID, CHARACTER_ID, SHARD_ID, CUSTOM_ACTION, CUSTOM_ACTION_TYPE, CUSTOM_ACTION_VALUE);
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!'''Appendix A'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								For those parameters that are classified as 'types' this appendix holds sample values for those parameters. You'll find sample type values for the following parameters below:
							Element:br
								*[[#_Account_Type | Account Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Ad_Tag_Name | Ad Tag Name]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Challenge_Type | Challenge Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Channel_Label | Channel Label]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Combat_Event_Type | Combat Event Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Country_Code | Country Code]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_CRM_Action_Type | CRM Action Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_CS_Action_Type | CS Action Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Custom_Action_Type | Custom Action Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Economic_Type | Economic Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Farmer_Type | Farmer Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Integrity_Flag_Type | Integrity Flag Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Item_Type | Item Type]]
							Element:br
								*[[#_Map_Type | Map Type]]
							Element:br

							Element:br

							Element:br

								!!!!'''Account Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Account Type describes the account payment type. Note that some accounts could have more than one Account Type value
							Element:br
								*Standard Transaction (All standard transactions from the site or store.)
							Element:br
								*Recurring Subscription
							Element:br
								*Store Card: Time
							Element:br
								*Store Card: In-App/Site Currency
							Element:br
								*Non-Paying
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Ad Tag Name'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								While the default Ad Tag Name is 'Unknown', alternate tags include 'In-App', 'Google', 'Facebook', 'Ad-Words', 'Other', and free text:
							Element:br
								**Ad4Game
							Element:br

								!!!!'''Challenge Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Challenges also include quests and missions.
							Element:br
								*Reach A Threshold Number Of Actions (Can include levels, e.g. Reach level 20.)
							Element:br
								*Reach A Threshold Number Of Points (Can be regular points, XP, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Kill An NPC Or Multiple NPCs
							Element:br
								*Find/Collect An Item, Or Items
							Element:br
								*Timed Event
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Channel Label'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Public
							Element:br
								*Group:Pre-Defined
							Element:br
								*Group:Ad-Hoc
							Element:br
								*Private
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Combat Event Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Solo Vs. Another Player
							Element:br
								*Solo Vs. NPC
							Element:br
								*Group Vs. Group
							Element:br
								*Group Vs. NPC
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Country Code'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Amongst the online resources you'll find a standardized list of [[http://developer.ninjametrics.com/docs/ | recommended country codes]]. If a non-standard country code is used Katana will convert it to one of the standardized codes, based on the nearest probable code.
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								----
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''CRM Action Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Free Item, Specific (A particular item giveaway.)
							Element:br
								*Free Item, Range (A range of items in a giveaway, therefore the user can pick from a range of items.)
							Element:br
								*Free Time
							Element:br
								*Discounted Item, Specific (A particular item offered at discount.)
							Element:br
								*Discounted Item, Range (A range of items offered at a discount, therefore the user can pick from a range of items.)
							Element:br
								*Discounted Time
							Element:br
								*Social Promotion – Shared (A shared promotion with a friend.)
							Element:br
								*Social Promotion - Pay Forward (A promotion passed on to a friend.)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''CS Action Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:Other
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:Item Correction
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:Stat Correction
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:User Temporarily Banned
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:User Permanently Banned
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:User Harrassment - Harasser
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:User Harrassment - Victim
							Element:br
								*In-Game Ticket:Account Compromised
							Element:br
								*Call Center:Item Correction
							Element:br
								*Call Center:Stat Correction
							Element:br
								*Call Center:User Temporarily Banned
							Element:br
								*Call Center:User Permanently Banned
							Element:br
								*Call Center:User Harrassment - Harasser
							Element:br
								*Call Center:User Harrassment - Victim
							Element:br
								*Call Center:Account Compromised
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Custom Action Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Custom Action Types is designed to hold types not found on any other list.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Note that each list already allows the addition of custom subtypes. This list should be used for whole categories that the system has not anticipated.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Economic Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Economic Types are related to in-game items not necessarily connected to a real-world value. This field also allows for a value for the item, whether in real-world or in-app currency.
							Element:br
								*Buy Item
							Element:br
								*Sell Item
							Element:br
								*Trade Away Item
							Element:br
								*Trade Acquire Item
							Element:br
								*Create Item
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Farmer Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								The following Farmer Type categories were developed by following the narco-trafficking system, and have been found to be reliable across game titles. Although some characters play multiple roles you should tag them with their primary function.
							Element:br
								*Banker (A Character used primarily to store virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Gatherer (A Character used primarily to gather virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Mule (A Character used primarily to transfer virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Spammer (A Character used primarily to advertise virtual goods.)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!''' Integrity Flag Type '''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Hacked Another's Account
							Element:br
								*Had Their Account Hacked
							Element:br
								*Credit Card Fraud
							Element:br
								*Cheating
							Element:br
								*Antisocial Behavior
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Item Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								If your system has UGC, items can have both an item type and a user-generated content type.
							Element:br
								*Raw Materials (Raw building block items used for crafting, creating enchantments, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Mounts And Pets
							Element:br
								*Weapons
							Element:br
								*Tools (e.g. an axe in Minecraft)
							Element:br
								*Armor
							Element:br
								*Upgrades, Buffs and Enchantments (Items that improve another item, e.g. cannons on a truck, more damage to a sword, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Display Items (Items that have little play value but look nice, e.g. candlesticks)
							Element:br
								*Aesthetic Items (Character skins or clothing that change appearance, but don't change character ability.)
							Element:br
								*Housing
							Element:br
								*Vehicle
							Element:br
								*Vendor Trash (Items that have no playable purpose.)
							Element:br
								*Containers
							Element:br
								*Tools
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Map Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Maps can vary greatly between genres, making map types fairly consistent within genres, but fairly inconsistent across them.
							Element:br
								*PVP
							Element:br
								*Capture The Flag
							Element:br
								*Deathmatch
							Element:br
								*Space
							Element:br
								*Land
							Element:br
								*Sea Or Underwater
							Element:br
								*Tower Defense
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''NPC Event Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Combat
							Element:br
								*Purchase
							Element:br
								*Quest/Challenge/Mission Given
							Element:br
								*Quest/Challenge/Mission Updated
							Element:br
								*Quest/Challenge/Mission Completed
							Element:br
								*NPC Joins Player Or Player's Group
							Element:br
								*NPC Leaves Player Or Player's Group
							Element:br
								*Dialog (Where the NPC says something, but doesn't trigger any event.)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''NPC Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Vendor
							Element:br
								*Enemy
							Element:br
								*Quest Giver
							Element:br
								*Companion
							Element:br
								*Pure Scenery
							Element:br
								*Dialog (Speech only NPCs)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''OGI Category Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								OGIs are out-of-game interactions; something users do out in the world that you, the developer, still tracks. This is likely to be social media or forum activity, but could be anything of use.
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Note that these could be used with sub-category breakdowns, allowing for more specific tracking.
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:FaceBook
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:GooglePlus
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:Tweets
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:Instagram
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:Vine
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:Pinterest
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:Other Social Media
							Element:br
								***Invite A Player:NA
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:FaceBook
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:GooglePlus
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:Tweets
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:Instagram
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:Vine
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:Pinterest
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:Other Social Media
							Element:br
								***Posts On Social Media:NA
							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:FaceBook
							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:GooglePlus
							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:Tweets
							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:Instagram
							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:Vine

							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:Other Social Media
							Element:br
								***Sends A Gift:NA
							Element:br
								***Posts On Game Forum:FaceBook
							Element:br
								***Posts On Game Forum:GooglePlus
							Element:br
								***Posts On Game Forum:Tweets
							Element:br
								***Posts On Game Forum:Instagram

								***Posts On Game Forum:Vine

							Element:br
								!!!!'''Recruitment Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Recruitment Type indicates how the user was invited to the service.
							Element:br
								*Invited By Another User
							Element:br
								*Ad-Website
							Element:br
								*Ad-Social Media
							Element:br
								*Ad-Mobile
							Element:br
								*Ad-Within Another App
							Element:br
								*Promotion
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Resource Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Currency
							Element:br
								*Power (Ability to take action, e.g. power in Facebook style F2P games that is used up and recharged over time unless purchased.)
							Element:br
								*Raw Materials (Items used for crafting or creating something.)
							Element:br
								*Vendor Trash (Items that have no playable purpose.)
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Social Event Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								*Send Message
							Element:br
								*Receive Message
							Element:br
								*Invite To Temporary Group (e.g. party or short-term group)
							Element:br
								*Invited To Temporary Group (e.g. party or short-term group)
							Element:br
								*Invite To Permanent Group (e.g. permanent group, guild, clan or team invite)
							Element:br
								*Invited To Permanent Group (e.g. permanent group, guild, clan or team invite)
							Element:br
								*Remove From Temporary Group (e.g. party or short-term group)
							Element:br
								*Removed From Temporary Group (e.g. party or short-term group)
							Element:br
								*Remove From Permanent Group
							Element:br
								*Removed From Permanent Group
							Element:br
								*Invite To Friend List
							Element:br
								*Invited To Friend List
							Element:br
								*Remove From Friend List
							Element:br
								*Removed From Friend List
							Element:br
								*Send Gift
							Element:br
								*Receive Gift
							Element:br
								*Invite To Sign Up For The Service/App/Game (e.g. a friend referral)
							Element:br
								*Invited To Sign Up For The Service/App/Game
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''Store Item Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								Store Item Types mirror Item Types, except that store items are transacted in the in-app store
							Element:br
								*Raw Materials (Raw building block items used for crafting, creating enchantments, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Mounts And Pets
							Element:br
								*Weapons
							Element:br
								*Tools (e.g. an axe in Minecraft)
							Element:br
								*Armor
							Element:br
								*Upgrades, Buffs and Enchantments (Items that improve another item, e.g. cannons on a truck, more damage to a sword, etc.)
							Element:br
								*Display Items (Items that have little play value but look nice, e.g. candlesticks.)
							Element:br
								*Aesthetic Items (Character skins or clothing that change appearance, but don't change character ability.)
							Element:br
								*Housing
							Element:br
								*Vehicle
							Element:br
								*Vendor Trash (Items that have no playable purpose.)
							Element:br
								*Containers
							Element:br
								*Tools
							Element:br
								*Other
							Element:br
							Element:br
								!!!!'''UGC Item Type'''
							Element:br
							Element:br
								User Generated Content Item Types mirror Item Types, but include additional sub-categories.
							Element:br

							Element:br
